current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve dental
		  health care for veterans, and for other purposes.

header.#text: Pilot program on expansion of furnishing of dental care to all enrolled veterans

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out a pilot program to assess the feasibility and advisability of furnishing dental care to veterans enrolled in the system of patient enrollment under
, who are not eligible for dental services and treatment, and related dental appliances, under current authorities.

text.#text: Commencing not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
The pilot program shall be carried out during the three-year period beginning on the date of the commencement of the pilot program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out the pilot program at  not fewer than 16 locations as follows:

text.#text: The
Four Department of Veterans Affairs medical centers with an established dental clinic.
Four Department medical centers with a current contract for the furnishing of dental care.
Four Community-Based Outpatient Clinics (CBOCs) with space available for the furnishing of services and treatment under the pilot program.
Four facilities selected from among Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) and Indian Health Service facilities with established dental clinics, of which—
at least one facility shall be such an Indian Health Service facility; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: any Indian Health Service facility so selected shall be selected in consultation with the
